newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan banks shares down in main bourse debut.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan banks shares down in main bourse debut.

text.p: Two bank shares that transferred directly to Taiwan's main stock exchange from the fledgling over-the-counter market fell sharply at mid-morning Friday as profit-taking soured their debut, brokers said.
At 0300 GMT, Grand Commercial Bank was down T$1.7 or 4.57 percent to T$35.5 and Dah Ah Bank fell T$1.7 or 4.56 percent to T$35.6.
Grand Commercial and Dah Ah were allowed to transfer to the main board after being listed in the OTC market for two years and meeting all of the main exchange's listing criteria.
